data.title: ASTER HOTEL GROUP
data.meta_description: Now $66 (Was $̶8̶8̶) on Tripadvisor: Aster Hotel Group, Tashkent. See 49 traveler reviews, 97 candid photos, and great deals for Aster Hotel Group, ranked #29 of 207 hotels in Tashkent and rated 4 of 5 at Tripadvisor.
data.text:
We visited Aster Hotel Group during winter in Tashkent Uzbekistan. The hotel construction and heating system is very good. Even though outside temperature was minus as soon as we arrived in our room it felt warm, like there was no cold weather outside. So comfy.

The hotel was new and fresh. It was a boutique hotel. The interior was nice. The room we stayed was classic with a touch of gold, while our kids rooms had different color themes, orange room, turquoise room, green room. The hot water was also working well.

The Wi fi was also good, relatively fast. The breakfast food was good too.

The location is also strategic not far from the airport. Close to Makro Supermarket. Quite close to Shopping Centers. Also some good restaurants near by. The area is in an elite area of yakessaray.

Would definitely go back there in the future.

Read more

I called the Toshkant location and negotiated a price for a 3 night stay. The guy I spoke to Dec 17 2021 (the hotel can check who was working) told me he had to “check with his manager” about the price. Well for 2 days this same guy phoned me 3 times and he said the manager finally agreed to the price. The time we spent talking was 2 hours. Relived that we found a hotel to stay at for the next 3 days, I reiterated the price and this guy said “no, that’s the price for ONE day.” WTF? This guy knew since the beginning of our phone conversations knew I was negotiating a 3-day stay. And even if he thought he was being clever in saying the price we negotiated was for a 1 day stay, why would I want to pay higher that what the Aster hotel—- and ANY other hotel in Toshkant was advertising for for 1 night? That’s like saying 1 apple costs 2 SOMS. I want 3 so I will give you 5 SOMS and the vendor tells you— after 2 hours and several phone calls over the course of 2 days—- “ok we agree: give me 5 SOMS for ONE apple”! These guys are swindling time-wasters. Maybe because it’s low travel season, they feel they can waste people’s time and cheat them. Maybe he thought I would just roll over because I had spent so much time with him on the phone. Well, I’m a very experienced traveller and had back up hotels. I’m also a WOMAN who has been to over 125 countries and know this $&&@ game this guy plays. Luring, lying, greed, and cheating is against the PILLARS of ISLAM! Well, we ended up staying at ANOTHER Toshkant hotel for 3 nights for the price I negotiated with Aster in the beginning. And Aster, for those 3 nights, remained EMPTY. BEWARE of these &&@“s!

Read more

Positive :

- comfortable room

- in quiet district

- the man at the front desk on morning of departure was really nice, it made up a little for the others - see below

Issues :

- the man at the reception on the day of our arrival was extremely unpleasant, almost rude. He clearly does not think much of serving clients.

- he first tried to sell us a more expensive room because it was noon and check out was 2pm, and "it was not yet ready". We showed a copy of the email where the hotel had accepted we could get into our room early for no charge, but he still refused. After insisting again, he gave us the room which was fully ready, so he had lied to us.

- when we came in the evening to settle our account, he asked us to pay for the full room. I told him we had already been debited a month before and showed him my bank account statement. He said this was only a guarantee and that we would be reimbursed of that.

- a month later, we have not been reimbursed and they tell us to deal with Booking

- the staff at the restaurant is not taking care of clients : you have to get up and fetch the menu yourself, and look for them all the time as they are not available. Same for breakfast where staff was grim looking. Service is very long.

- breakfast was of lower quality and choice than all the others we had in the country

- hotel equipment not on par with the price (no swimming pool, no fitness etc)

Read more
